poem:
***After the Fire***

The rains come, cleansing,  
yet bearing the earth's scars—  
ashes that seep  
through fragile veins of the land.  
Beneath the quiet weep of skies,  
mud slips—nature's sorrow,  
washing over the wounds  
a blaze spoke.  
In the dance of elements,  
hope turns heavy,  
undulating with silent cries  
beneath what remains.
